# cato_group (Resource)

The `cato_group` resource contains the configuration parameters necessary to manage a group. Groups can contain various member types including sites, hosts, network ranges, and more. Documentation for the underlying API used in this resource can be found at [mutation.groups.createGroup()](https://api.catonetworks.com/documentation/#mutation-groups.createGroup).



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `members` (Attributes Set) List of group members. Each member has 'name', 'id', and 'type' fields. You can specify either 'name' or 'id' when creating/updating; both will be populated in state. At least one member is required. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--members))
- `name` (String) Group name

### Optional

- `description` (String) Group description

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Group ID

<a id="nestedatt--members"></a>
### Nested Schema for `members`

Required:

- `type` (String) Member type: FLOATING_SUBNET, GLOBAL_IP_RANGE, HOST, NETWORK_INTERFACE, SITE, SITE_NETWORK_SUBNET

Optional:

- `id` (String) Member ID (computed if not specified)
- `name` (String) Member name (computed if not specified)
